thread.title: Man dies after car hit by train on level crossing
thread.title_full: Man dies after car hit by train on level crossing | West Country - ITV News

author: itv.com
title: Man dies after car hit by train on level crossing
text:
A man has died after a train hit a car on a level crossing in Gloucestershire. Credit: Gavin Garthwaite/Twitter A man has died after a train ploughed into his car on a level crossing in Gloucestershire, British Transport Police have said.
The incident happened near Frampton Mansell at about 3.10pm.
The Great Western Railway train was travelling from London Paddington to Cheltenham Spa when it hit the vehicle which the man is believed to have been driving.
Police said no-one else was injured in the crash.
GWR Help @GWRHelp Follow Following an incident at a level crossing the lines between Swindon and Gloucester are currently closed. Replacement buses are in operation.
16:14 - 7 Feb 2017 Retweet Reply Favourite The incident happened around 3.10pm in Frampton Mansell. Credit: Gavin Garthwaite/Twitter Officers from British Transport Police say they attended the scene alongside paramedics from the South Western Ambulance Service.
The man was pronounced dead at the scene and officers are now working to identify him and inform his family.
Passengers were evacuated from the train and there were no reported injuries. Credit: Gavin Garthwaite/Twitter Great Western Railway said it appeared no passengers aboard the train had been injured.
A spokesman said:
The 13.36 Paddington to Cheltenham service was involved in a collision with a vehicle at Frampton Mansell level crossing near Kemble.
British Transport Police have confirmed that a man, believed to be the driver of the vehicle, has unfortunately died at the scene.
We are thankful that no injuries have been reported from passengers or staff on board the train, and are working with the British Transport Police and other relevant authorities to understand the full circumstances of the incident as quickly as possible."
â€“ GWR spokesman A police cordon is now up around the scene. Credit: Gavin Garthwaite/Twitter Martyn Smith @SmithMartynD Follow Our train has hit a vehicle at Frampton Mansell. No trains between Kemble and Stroud any time soon, I'd say. https://t.co/lsYDtRpSqy
15:51 - 7 Feb 2017 Retweet Reply Favourite A police cordon has now been put up around the scene and passengers from the train have been taken to a local pub.
Last updated Tue 7 Feb 2017 Gloucestershire level crossing
